subject: Re: [junit] Is it possible to have write NonBlocking Junit tests
msgSnippet: You could use a locking mechanism shared between your test and handler so that progress continues as quick as possible and then put an overall timeout on your
messageBody:
You could use a locking mechanism shared between your test and handler so that progress continues as quick as possible and then put an overall timeout on your test in the event of failure.

Something like this should work just fine:

@Test
public void testAsync() throws Exception {
final Semaphore lock = new Semaphore(0);
someAsyncCode(new Handler() {
public void handle() {
// put your assertions in here
lock.release();
}  
});
lock.acquire();
}
